occurrences.line_text: Like Hesperus emongst the lesser lights,
Some framd faire lookes, glancing like euening lights,
But for so much as to my lot here lights,
Which glyding through the ayre lights all the heauens darke.
All other lesser lights in light excell,
Light-shonning theft, and traiterous intent,
O lightsome day, the lampe of highest Ioue,
Ere they into the lightsome world were brought,
Vntill she spide the lampe of lightsome day,
To seeke his kindred, and the lignage right,
His loues and lignage Arthur tells
For both the lignage and the certain Sire,
Of what loines and what lignage I did spring:
Of whom all Faeryes spring, and fetch their lignage right.
Whose lignage from this Lady I deriue along.
Like Phoebus lampe throughout the world doth shine,
Vpon his shield the like was also scor'd,
And like to lead the labyrinth about;
A litle glooming light, much like a shade,
Halfe like a serpent horribly displaide,
And henceforth euer wish, that like succeed it may.
With which and other spelles like terrible,
Legions of Sprights, the which like little flyes
Mixt with a murmuring winde, much like the sowne
So liuely, and so like in all mens sight,
Cast a blacke stole, most like to seeme for Vna fit.
Most like that virgin true, which for her knight him took.
Like a young Squire, in loues and lusty-hed
Now like a foxe, now like a dragon fell,
Now like a foxe, now like a dragon fell,
And like a Persian mitre on her hed
With tinsell trappings, wouen like a waue,
Like the old ruines of a broken towre,
That had a like faire Lady by his syde,
Like a faire Lady, but did fowle Duessa hyde.
Affraid, least to themselues the like mishappen might.
Then forth they ranne like two amazed deare,
By his like seeming shield, her knight by name
Much like, as when the beaten marinere,
Like loathsome lazars, by the hedges lay.
Like euer saw. And there a noble crew
Exceeding shone, like Phoebus fairest childe,
With like conditions to their kinds applyde:
Like to an holy Monck, the seruice to begin.
And like a Crane his necke was long and fyne,
And all the way, most like a brutish beast,
In shape and life more like a monster, then a man.
Was like the person selfe, whom he did beare:
And him no lesse, that any like did vse,
I no whit reck, ne you the like need to reherce.
And heaped blowes like yron hammers great:
And doubled strokes, like dreaded thunders threat:
With like attempt to like end to renew.
With like attempt to like end to renew.
Like carkases of beasts in butchers stall.
And thousands moe the like, that did that dongeon fill.
There dwell in perill of like painefull plight,
For many corses, like a great Lay-stall
That molten starres do drop like weeping eyes;
Whose like he neuer saw, he durst not bide,
Leaping like wanton kids in pleasant Spring.
In these and like delights of bloudy game
And now he thither came for like intent;
Whose like in womens wit he neuer knew;
Arise, and with like treason now maintain
To seeme like Truth, whose shape she well can faine,
About the fountaine like a girlond made;
Which like a feuer fit through all his body swelt.
His liuing like saw neuer liuing eye,
Like glauncing light of Phoebus brightest ray;
That shynd, like twinkling stars, with stons most pretious rare.
Shapt like a Ladies head, exceeding shone,
Like Hesperus emongst the lesser lights,
Like to an Almond tree ymounted hye
And trembling with strange feare, did like an earthquake show.
He smote off his left arme, which like a blocke
Forth gushed, like fresh water streame from riuen rocke.
And threatned all his heads like flaming brands.
And twixt him and his Lord did like a bulwarke stand.
Was nothing left, but like an emptie bladder was.
Decayd, and all his flesh shronk vp like withered flowres.
Is to be wise, and ware of like agein.
Her dried dugs, like bladders lacking wind,
For one of them was like an Eagles claw,
The other like a Beares vneuen paw:
Ne liuing man like words did euer heare,
Whose like infirmitie like chaunce may beare:
Whose like infirmitie like chaunce may beare:
That like would not for all this worldes wealth:
His subtill tongue, like dropping honny, mealt'th
Darke, dolefull, drearie, like a greedie graue,
Yet death then, would the like mishaps forestall,
And tremble like a leafe of Aspin greene,
Like sunny beames threw from her Christall face,
And round about her head did shine like heauens light.
Who them encounters with like courtesie;
That drops of bloud thence like a well did play;
That like a Lyon he would cry and rore,
That bloud-red billowes like a walled front
Or like that sacred hill, whose head full hie,
Or like that pleasaunt Mount, that is for ay
These that haue it attaind, were in like cace
(Quoth he) as wretched, and liu'd in like paine.
Of a great hill, himselfe like a great hill.
Like plated coate of steele, so couched neare,
Were like two sayles, in which the hollow wynd
Were like mayne-yards, with flying canuas lynd,
Wide gaped, like the griesly mouth of hell,
His blazing eyes, like two bright shining shields,
That from thenceforth he shund the like to take,
He lowdly brayd, that like was neuer heard,
Like Eyas hauke vp mounts vnto the skies,
In all the world like was not to be found,
Another like faire tree eke grew thereby,
So downe he fell, and like an heaped mountaine lay.
That seemd like silke and siluer wouen neare,
Came running in, much like a man dismaid,
Like as it had bene many an Angels voice,
Of such, as vertues like mote vnto him allye.
Must now anew begin, like race to runne;
Shapt like a maid, that such ye may her know;
But euer like her selfe vnstained hath beene tryde.
And on his shield like yron sledges bet:
But he, not like a wearie traueilere,
But Huddibras, more like a Malecontent,
He hath a sword, that flames like burning brond.
Like roses in a bed of lillies shed,
Like a broad table did it selfe dispred,
Sweet words, like dropping honny she did shed,
Like twinckling starres, and all the skirt about
Like two faire marble pillours they were seene,
Her daintie paps; which like young fruit in May
Her yellow lockes crisped, like golden wyre,
They waued like a penon wide dispred,
As all the like, which honour haue pursewed
Shakt his long lockes, colourd like copper-wire,
Ere long with like againe he boorded mee,
Disguised like that groome of base degree,
But rudely rag'd, and like a cruell Tygre far'd.
Like as a Lyon, whose imperiall powre
Some framd faire lookes, glancing like euening lights,
Others sweet words, dropping like honny dew;
He, like an Adder, lurking in the weeds,
That like a litle forrest seemed outwardly.
Both slow and swift a like do serue my tourne,
Emongst wide waues set, like a litle nest,
In smithes fire-spitting forge, and nayles like clawes appeard.
Like Angels life was then mens happy cace;
But later ages pride, like corn-fed steed,
Like an huge caue, hewne out of rocky clift,
Like an huge Gyant of the Titans race,
On earth like neuer grew, ne liuing wight
Like euer saw, but they from hence were sold;
Infinite moe, tormented in like paine
Like mightie pillours, this fraile life of man,
The flitting skyes, like flying Pursuiuant,
Like Phoebus face adornd with sunny rayes,
Decked with diuerse plumes, like painted Iayes,
Like as Cupido on IdÃ¦an hill,
Then like a Lion, which hath long time saught
Sterne was their looke, like wild amazed steares,
Like scattered Sheepe, whenas the Shepheards swaine
But of thing like to that ï¿½/-gyptian slime,
Like highest heauen compassed around,
But not on ground mote like to this be found,
Like many swarmes of Bees assembled round,
But like wild beasts lurking in loathsome den,
Like Noyes great flood, with their importune sway,
This land inuaded with like violence,
Ne like in grace, ne like in learned skill;
Ne like in grace, ne like in learned skill;
No wretchednesse is like to sinfull vellenage.
There Alma like a virgin Queene most bright,
Headed like Owles, with beckes vncomely bent,
Others like Dogs, others like Gryphons dreare,
Others like Dogs, others like Gryphons dreare,
Some hauing heads like Harts, some like to Snakes,
Some hauing heads like Harts, some like to Snakes,
Some like wild Bores late rouzd out of the brakes;
Whose hideous shapes were like to feends of hell,
Some like to hounds, some like to Apes, dismayd,
Some like to hounds, some like to Apes, dismayd,
Some like to Puttockes, all in plumes arayd:
Some mouth'd like greedy Oystriges, some fast
Like loathly Toades, some fashioned in the wast
Like swine; for so deformd is luxury,
For some like Snailes, some did like spyders shew,
For some like Snailes, some did like spyders shew,
And some like vgly Vrchins thicke and short:
Like a great water flood, that tombling low
The fierce Spumador trode them downe like docks,
That like a ghost he seem'd, whose graue-clothes were vnbound.
And skin all withered like a dryed rooke,
Like as a fire, the which in hollow caue
Like did he neuer heare, like did he neuer see.
Like did he neuer heare, like did he neuer see.
Like two mad dogs they ran about the lands,
Like to a restlesse wheele, still running round,
The surging waters like a mountaine rise,
Of Death, and like him lookes in dreadfull hew,
And did like an halfe Theatre fulfill:
With vermell, like the boyes bloud therein shed,
Of niggard Nature, like a pompous bride
No gate, but like one, being goodly dight
Some like faire Emeraudes, not yet well ripened.
That like a little lake it seemd to bee;
That like pure Orient perles adowne it trild,
Fraile harts, yet quenched not; like starry light
According to their mindes like monstruous.
And eke the Prince like treaty handeled,
Like dastard Curres, that hauing at a bay
Her mantle, colour'd like the starry skyes,
Like sparkes of fire, which fall in sclender flex,
That from like inward fire that outward smoke had steemd.
Faire Lady she him seemd, like Lady drest,
At tilt or tourney, or like warlike game,
For pleasing words are like to Magick art,
Like to the world it selfe, and seem'd a world of glas.
Like an huge Aetn' of deepe engulfed griefe,
But mine is not (quoth she) like others wound;
Was neuer such, but mote the like be found,
And like a shadow wexe, whiles with entire
Nought like (quoth she) for that same wretched boy
She shortly like a pyned ghost became,
Like as a Lyon, that in drowsie caue
How like a Gyaunt in each manly part
Like a swift Otter, fell through emptinesse,
But Penda, fearefull of like desteny,
Whose brother Oswin, daunted with like dread,
Like as the sacred Oxe, that carelesse stands,
Like to thicke cloudes, that threat a stormy showre,
And vauted all within, like to the sky,
Like as a fearefull Doue, which through the raine,
Whose like in Faery lond were seldome seene,
Like as a ship, whose Lodestarre suddenly
In whose faire eyes, like lamps of quenched fire,
His locks, like faded leaues fallen to grownd,
His watry eyes, drizling like deawy raine,
And like a stately Theatre it made,
Adorne the world with like to heauenly light,
She bore Belphoebe, she bore in like cace
Whiles all her Nymphes did like a girlond her enclose.
The like that mine, may be your paine another tide.
Least he like one of them him selfe disguize,
So like a wheele around they runne from old to new.
But like a girlond compassed the hight,
Like as an Hynd forth singled from the heard,
That like two Orient pearles, did purely shyne
Like to a ghost, that lately is reuiued
Like neuer yet did liuing eye detect;
But trembled like a lambe, fled from the pray,
Like as a Goshauke, that in foote doth beare
All were the beame in bignesse like a mast,
In loathly wise like to a carion corse,
So liu'd they euer after in like sin,
And with like labour walke the world around,
But all my dayes am like to wast in vaine,
Like to Florimell,
Whose like on earth was neuer framed yit,
To make another like the former Dame,
So liuely and so like, that many it mistooke.
That like a liuely sanguine it seem'd to the eye.
In siluer sockets, shyning like the skyes,
To stirre and roll them, like a womans eyes;
Like as a fearefull Partridge, that is fled
Then like a Faerie knight himselfe he drest;
Then like a king he was to her exprest,
Now like a Gyant, now like to a feend,
Now like a Gyant, now like to a feend,
Then like a Centaure, then like to a storme,
Then like a Centaure, then like to a storme,
But he is old, and withered like hay,
Like as the rest, late entrance deare besought;
But like so as the rest he prayd for nought,
He forth issew'd; like as a boistrous wind,
That each awhile lay like a sencelesse corse.
Was for like need enforst to disaray:
And raught vnto her heeles; like sunny beames,
Like as Minerua, being late returnd
With breathed flames, like to a furnace red,
And with the like him answerd euermore:
And thousands like, which flowed in his braine,
At last resoluing, like a pilgrim pore,
Discolour'd like to womanish disguise,
Bigge looking like a doughtie Doucepere,
At wilde aduenture, like a forlorne weft,
And like a Gote emongst the Gotes did rush,
Ne scarsely who before: like as a Beare
And nothing left, but like an aery Spright,
But with like fiercenesse did ensew the chace:
Like a discolourd Snake, whose hidden snares
Now like a Ram, faire Helle to peruart,
Now like a Bull, Europa to withdraw:
And like a fire, when he Aegin' assayd:
And like a Serpent to the Thracian mayd.
So like, that all the walles did seeme to flame.
Now like a Lyon, hunting after spoile,
Now like a Stag, now like a faulcon flit:
Now like a Stag, now like a faulcon flit:
And like a winged horse he tooke his flight,
So liuely and so like, that liuing sence it fayld.
The first was Fancy, like a louely boy,
Like as the sunburnt Indians do aray
She dolefull Lady, like a dreary Spright,
There were full many moe like maladies,
And quenched quite, like a consumed torch,
Like as a Deare, that greedily embayes
But like two senceles stocks in long embraceme[n]t dwelt.
And to her selfe oft wisht like happinesse,
Released her, that else was like to sterue,
And like a silken veile in compasse round
Like as the shining skie in summers night,
For though like withered tree, that wanteth iuyce,
With two companions of like qualitie,
Like knight aduenturous in outward vew,
Albee in heart he like affection fond,
Ye will me now with like good turne repay,
Like shaft out of a bow preuenting speed.
Like as a gloomie cloud, the which doth beare
Whose like aliue on earth he weened not:
Now with recounting of like former breaches
Like two mad mastiffes each on other flew,
Full many knights, that loued her like deare,
Like faithfull friends thenceforth to ioyne in one
Ne dare I like, but through infusion sweete
But like to warie Centonels well stayd,
Like three faire branches budding farre and wide,
And like that roote that doth her life diuide,
Tossing them like a boate amid the mayne,
Like an old Oke whose pith and sap is seare,
Like as his mother prayd the Destinie,
But riued were like rotten wood a sunder,
And fire did flash, like lightning after thunder,
Like as a Snake, whom wearie winters teene,
Like as the tide that comes fro th'Ocean mayne,
Adowne their sides like litle riuers stremed,
Like as a withered tree through husbands toyle
Towards them driuing like a storme out sent.
Great heapes of them, like sheepe in narrow fold,
Like to the rod which Maias sonne doth wield,
And they like men astonisht still did stand.
Without regard of good, dyes like ill grounded seeds.
Another like, that were like faire and bright,
Another like, that were like faire and bright,
Like as it seemed best to euery one;
And looking round about, like one dismaid,
Like sparke of fire that from the anduile glode.
Like as a Lion that by chaunce doth fall
Like captive thral two other Knights atweene,
For all his armour was like saluage weed,
Far'd like a lyon in his bloodie game,
Like as in sommers day when raging heat
Which else was like to haue bene lost, and bore
As like can not be seene from East to West,
The which like thornes did pricke his gealous hart,
And through his soule like poysned arrow perst,
They spide a little cottage, like some poore mans nest.
Of muddie water, that like puddle stanke;
Like belles in greatnesse orderly succeed,
He like a monstrous Gyant seem'd in sight,
Like to the Northren winde, that none could heare:
Then vp he rose like heauie lumpe of lead,
Like as the lightning brond from riuen skie,
Like to the ruddie morne appeard in sight,
Like to a golden border did appeare,
For it did glister like the golden sand,
Like to a stubborne steede whom strong hand would restraine.
But senselesse stood, like to a mazed steare,
Yet was no man, but onely like in shape,
With huge great teeth, like to a tusked Bore:
His neather lip was not like man nor beast,
But like a wide deepe poke, downe hanging low,
For all his haire was like a garment seene;
Vnweeting of thine owne like haplesse plight:
But what are you, whom like vnlucky lot
But like a ghastly Gelt, whose wits are reaued,
But ouerleapes them all, like Robucke light,
The place there ouerflowne, seemd like a sodaine flood.
That like a pined ghost he soone appeares.
But like strange wight, whom he had seene no where,
And pitty much his plight, that liu'd like outcast thrall.
Like as it fell to this vnhappy boy,
Which losse her made like passion also proue.
Shap'd like a heart, yet bleeding of the wound,
Like ghost late risen from his graue agryz'd,
From his moist eies, and like two streames procead;
For like the stings of Aspes, that kill with smart,
Of time, did liue then like an innocent,
Like as a curre doth felly bite and teare
Like as the Basiliske of serpents seede,
And were her vertue like her beautie bright,
For neuer two so like did liuing creature see.
Of our like persons eath to be disguiz'd,
Came forth full weake and wan, not like him selfe to bee.
For they so like in person did appeare,
Their like resemblaunce much admired there,
Left in the victors powre, like vassall bond;
Whose like they neuer saw till that same houre:
Like to a storme, which houers vnder skie
That like on earth no where I recken may:
Either through gifts, or guile, or such like waies,
Which loued not as these, for like intent,
To all the heathen Gods, might like to this be clamed.
She wore much like vnto a Danisk hood
Pure in aspect, and like to christall glasse,
Whose shapes seem'd not like to terrestriall boyes,
But like to Angels playing heauenly toyes;
Whose eyes like twinkling stars in euening cleare,
Like to the Morne, when first her shyning face
Like warie Hynd within the weedie soyle,
All looking on, and like astonisht staring,
She lenger yet is like captiu'd to bee:
Like to the balefull house of lowest hell,
There with the Nymph his mother, like her thrall;
On which the waues, glittering like Christall glas,
And on his head like to a Coronet
Like as the mother of the Gods, they say,
With hundred turrets, like a Turribant.
And Mole, that like a nousling Mole doth make
Like a wood God, and flowing fast to Rhy:
Whose like none else could shew, the which they Ruffins call.
Then came those sixe sad brethren, like forlorne,
The spacious Shenan spreading like a sea,
The spreading Lee, that like an Island fayre
That seem'd like siluer, sprinckled here and theare
With glittering spangs, that did like starres appeare,
And wau'd vpon, like water Chamelot,
Did tricle downe her haire, like to the hore
Both clad in colours like, and like array,
Both clad in colours like, and like array,
Laomedia, like the christall sheene;
Till like a victor on his backe he ride,
Like as an Hynde whose calfe is falne vnwares
And all the way did inly mourne, like one astray.
That nothing like himselfe he seem'd in sight.
Like ruefull ghost, vnable once to stirre or moue.
And makes them like himselfe in glorious sight,
Next Hercules his like ensample shewed,
Bursting forth teares, like springs out of a banke,
That on the ground he layd him like a sencelesse blocke.
Bound like a beast appointed to the stall:
Could swim like to a fish, whiles he his backe bestrad.
But Talus, that could like a limehound winde her,
For neuer there the like resort they knew.
Like as the sea (which plaine he shewed there)
Like foolish flies about an hony crocke,
Hemd in with waters like a wall in sight;
They liue, they die, like as he doth ordaine,
Like as a ship, whom cruell tempest driues
He like a swarme of flyes them ouerthrew;
And through the thickest like a Lyon flew,
But like as one, whom feends had made affrayd,
Like the true saint beside the image set,
That like a lifelesse corse immoueable he stood.
While she was flying, like a weary weft,
Shapt like a horses shoe, who list to seeke it there.
But like a little Mount of small degree;
But they like tyrants, mercilesse the more,
But bread and water, or like feeble thing,
With that, like one that hopelesse was repryu'd
And like a sort of Bees in clusters swarmed:
Ere long their Queene her selfe, halfe like a man
Like a fell Lionesse at him she flew,
Like to an Eagle in his kingly pride,
But like a sort of sheepe dispersed farre
What euer he shall like to doe or say.
Like as the workeman had their courses taught;
That to the Moone it mote be like in each respect.
But he that had like tempests often tride,
Like as a Smith that to his cunning feat
And like a greedie Beare vnto her pray,
Like as the Moone in foggie winters night,
Like one that from his dreame is waked suddenlye.
Like as a Puttocke hauing spyde in sight
And through her eyes like sudden lightning flashed,
Of his demeane: thenceforth not like a louer,
But like a rebell stout I will him vse.
And to her chamber went like solitary cell.
Like as a wayward childe, whose sounder sleepe
Like to a Spaniell wayting carefully
That here and there like scattred sheepe they lay.
He had three sonnes, all three like fathers sonnes,
Like treacherous, like full of fraud and guile,
Like treacherous, like full of fraud and guile,
Streight was the passage like a ploughed ridge,
Like coles, that through a siluer Censer sparkle bright.
They wore rich Mitres shaped like the Moone,
Like as Osyris signifies the Sunne.
For that they both like race in equall iustice runne.
Whose like before she neuer saw nor red;
Like to a weake faint-hearted man he fared,
Like one adawed with some dreadfull spright.
Like to Osyris in all iust endeuer.
Like fruitles seede, of which vntimely death should grow.
Like to an hideous storme, which nothing may empeach.
Whom like disguize no lesse deformed had,
Carried with wings of feare, like fowle aghast,
But he like hound full greedy of his pray,
Like fiercely met. But Artegall was stronger,
And tottred like two towres, which through a tempest quooke.
